# NSEvent.EventType

**Enumeration**

Constants for the types of events that responder objects can handle.

## Declaration

```swift
enum EventType
```

## Overview

These constants appear in the event’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSEvent/type] property. You also use them when you construct new events.

## Getting Mouse-Related Event Types

- **NSEvent.EventType.leftMouseDown**: The user pressed the left mouse button.
- **NSEvent.EventType.leftMouseDragged**: The user moved the mouse while holding down the left mouse button.
- **NSEvent.EventType.leftMouseUp**: The user released the left mouse button.
- **NSEvent.EventType.rightMouseDown**: The user pressed the right mouse button.
- **NSEvent.EventType.rightMouseUp**: The user released the right mouse button.
- **NSEvent.EventType.rightMouseDragged**: The user moved the mouse while holding down the right mouse button.
- **NSEvent.EventType.otherMouseDown**: The user pressed a tertiary mouse button.
- **NSEvent.EventType.otherMouseDragged**: The user moved the mouse while holding down a tertiary mouse button.
- **NSEvent.EventType.otherMouseUp**: The user released a tertiary mouse button.
- **NSEvent.EventType.mouseMoved**: The user moved the mouse in a way that caused the cursor to move onscreen.
- **NSEvent.EventType.mouseEntered**: The cursor entered a well-defined area, such as a view.
- **NSEvent.EventType.mouseExited**: The cursor exited a well-defined area, such as a view.

## Getting Keyboard Event Types

- **NSEvent.EventType.keyDown**: The user pressed a key on the keyboard.
- **NSEvent.EventType.keyUp**: The user released a key on the keyboard.

## Getting Touch-Based Events

- **NSEvent.EventType.beginGesture**: An event marking the beginning of a gesture.
- **NSEvent.EventType.endGesture**: An event that marks the end of a gesture.
- **NSEvent.EventType.magnify**: The user performed a pinch-open or pinch-close gesture.
- **NSEvent.EventType.smartMagnify**: The user performed a smart-zoom gesture.
- **NSEvent.EventType.swipe**: The user performed a swipe gesture.
- **NSEvent.EventType.rotate**: The user performed a rotate gesture.
- **NSEvent.EventType.gesture**: The user performed a nonspecific type of gesture.
- **NSEvent.EventType.directTouch**: The user touched a portion of the touch bar.
- **NSEvent.EventType.tabletPoint**: The user touched a point on a tablet.
- **NSEvent.EventType.tabletProximity**: A pointing device is near, but not touching, the associated tablet.
- **NSEvent.EventType.pressure**: An event that reports a change in pressure on a pressure-sensitive device.

## Getting Other Input Types

- **NSEvent.EventType.scrollWheel**: The scroll wheel position changed.
- **NSEvent.EventType.changeMode**: The user changed the mode of a connected device.

## Getting System Event Types

- **NSEvent.EventType.appKitDefined**: An AppKit-related event occurred.
- **NSEvent.EventType.applicationDefined**: An app-defined event occurred.
- **NSEvent.EventType.cursorUpdate**: An event that updates the cursor.
- **NSEvent.EventType.flagsChanged**: The event flags changed.
- **NSEvent.EventType.periodic**: An event that provides execution time to periodic tasks.
- **NSEvent.EventType.quickLook**: An event that initiates a Quick Look request.
- **NSEvent.EventType.systemDefined**: A system-related event occurred.

## Enumeration Cases

- **NSEvent.EventType.mouseCancelled**

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Getting the event type

- **type**: The event’s type.
- **NSEvent.EventTypeMask**: Constants that you use to filter out specific event types from the stream of incoming events.
- **subtype**: The event’s subtype.
- **NSEvent.EventSubtype**: Subtypes for various types of events.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
